bill.summary: 3/31/1988--Introduced. Disapproves the determination by the Bureau of International Narcotics Matters of the Department of State that Haiti is not a major drug-transit nation, within the meaning of the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961, for the trafficking of illegal narcotics into the United States. Urges the President to mandate that Haiti be classified as a major drug transshipment nation, subject to the certification process mandated by that Act.
